doc:
Montgomery Clift https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Montgomery_Clift 0 Edward Montgomery "Monty" Clift (; October 17, 1920 – July 23, 1966) was an American actor. His New York Times obituary noted his portrayal of "moody, sensitive young men". He is best remembered for roles in Red River (1948), The Heiress (1949), A Place in the Sun (1951), Alfred Hitchcock's I Confess (1953), From Here to Eternity (1953), The Young Lions (1958), Judgment at Nuremberg (1961), and The Misfits (1961). He received four Academy Award nominations during his career: three for Best Actor and one for Best Supporting Actor. Along with Marlon Brando and James Dean, Clift was one of the original method actors in Hollywood; he was one of the first actors to be invited to study in the Actors Studio with Lee Strasberg and Elia Kazan. He also executed a rare move by not signing a contract after arriving in Hollywood, only doing so after his first two films were a success. This was described as "a power differential that would go on to structure the star-studio relationship for the next 40 years". Edward_Montgomery_"_Monty_"_Clift ( ; October_17_,_1920 – July_23_,_1966 ) was an_American_actor . His_New_York_Times_obituary noted his_portrayal of " moody , sensitive_young_men " . He is_best_remembered for roles in Red_River_(_1948_) , The_Heiress_(_1949_) , A_Place in the_Sun_(_1951_) , Alfred_Hitchcock 's_I Confess (_1953_) , From Here to Eternity_(_1953_) , The_Young_Lions ( 1958_) , Judgment at Nuremberg_(_1961_) , and The_Misfits ( 1961_) . He received four_Academy_Award_nominations during his_career : three_for_Best_Actor and one_for_Best_Supporting_Actor . Along with Marlon_Brando and James_Dean , Clift was one of the_original_method_actors in Hollywood ; he was one of the_first_actors to_be_invited to_study in the_Actors_Studio with Lee_Strasberg and Elia_Kazan . He also executed a_rare_move by not_signing a_contract after arriving in Hollywood , only doing so after his_first_two_films were a_success . This was_described as " a_power_differential that would_go on to_structure the_star-studio_relationship for the_next_40_years " .
